body:
Long story short, admins and a majority of Ruqqus Discord strongly dislike the current â€œnaziâ€ - yeah, they use that term unironically - userbase. A good amount of Ruqqord users want to shit on and drive users they donâ€™t like off the site and admins seem to want to replace their base and cater to a more mainstream audience. These users for all intents and purposes hate Ruqqus and Ruqqus users, would be happier on Reddit, and are consistently (purposely) demoralizing when it doesnâ€™t make sense to be. Yet the admins seem more than willing to take cues from them.

So you have users that are generally popular or at least neutral with the Ruqqus base getting eyed, jumped on, and treated spitefully by the admins because the Ruqqord base hates and constantly complains about those users. Yet, youâ€™ve got those same Ruqqord users in the RCP server planning brigades, sieging and subverting guilds of users they get banned, playing Carps games and being obnoxious to everybody else and the Admins do nothing.

The admins always side with Ruqqord over the Ruqqus base. Because they donâ€™t like the Ruqqus base. And, Ruqqord is really just a few loud, whiny people typing the same thing over and over and then the rest just falling in line after they know what to think.

Basically, it seems like they want Redditâ€™s userbase and resent the niche that they already have and can build upon because it doesnâ€™t make Ruqqus look favorable to the mainstream. They donâ€™t want to promote Ruqqus and refuse to market it until theyâ€™ve released Vue and are better able to hide the â€œundesirables.â€

So, if it feels like thereâ€™s animosity towards a bunch of the users here and like theyâ€™re working against you, they kind of are.

That is my experience and take away from being in the Ruqqord

body:
From what Iâ€™ve seen, thatâ€™s not unique to Ruqqord though sadly. 

There have always been vocal opponents of â€œcertain partsâ€ of free speech. Youâ€™d think that users on a free speech focused site would be more open minded but so far I donâ€™t think thatâ€™s the case. 

Lots of people have strong ideas about what Ruqqus needs to do to succeed. I think they usually have good intentions but their actions donâ€™t necessarily support free speech. 

For what itâ€™s worth, I donâ€™t think the admins hate the user base. If anything, I think they are struggling to find a way to promote free speech without letting extreme, potentially alienating ideas dominate the site (to the point where it drives away prospective users)

post.title: If youâ€™re wondering, hereâ€™s whatâ€™s going on; Ruqqus Discord doesnâ€™t like you.

body:
I don't think it's unreasonable to want to serve a wider audience - the majority of posts made on here cater to a very specific (and often toxic) group of people. Whether it's disinformation, far-right circlejerking, or straight-up racism, most people don't want to see it. I supported the admins' decision to hide political guilds from All by default - it should help cultivate a broader audience by bolstering non-political guilds. Without those, Ruqqus is basically just Voat but slightly less degenerate. 

What I *don't* support, however, is the formation of Ruqqus's AHS analogue (Ruqqus Corrective Project), the weaponization of the platform's Siege function, and the approval these actions seem to have from the admins. This runs counter to the platform's core value: free speech. 

I'm hoping that the admins will see this outcry from their community and find a way to make the site presentable to non-political users, while not stifling those who want to participate in the political side of things. It seems like once they modify the Siege function to only be usable in the case of inactive GMs, we'll see some progress.
body_html:
I don't think it's unreasonable to want to serve a wider audience - the majority of posts made on here cater to a very specific (and often toxic) group of people. Whether it's disinformation, far-right circlejerking, or straight-up racism, most people don't want to see it. I supported the admins' decision to hide political guilds from All by default - it should help cultivate a broader audience by bolstering non-political guilds. Without those, Ruqqus is basically just Voat but slightly less degenerate.

What I don't support, however, is the formation of Ruqqus's AHS analogue (Ruqqus Corrective Project), the weaponization of the platform's Siege function, and the approval these actions seem to have from the admins. This runs counter to the platform's core value: free speech.

I'm hoping that the admins will see this outcry from their community and find a way to make the site presentable to non-political users, while not stifling those who want to participate in the political side of things. It seems like once they modify the Siege function to only be usable in the case of inactive GMs, we'll see some progress.

body:
I agree that a wider base is needed. I donâ€™t agree that that wider base looks like the Reddit base. I think it looks more like the privacy crowd + the Parler base + non-woke gamers + libertarian and conservative podcast audiences + the crypto crowd + BitChute base + Mixer and Dlive base + etc...

The target audience should NOT look like Redditors and Twitter users and Facebook people and activists, etc... the niche - the target audience - is people 18-35 thick-skinned, privacy conscious individuals looking for *alternatives* to big tech and mainstream media. They need to develop that profile and target those people - thereâ€™s a ton of them and they know nothing about Ruqqus. Stop targeting Redditors. 

What I donâ€™t like is the feeling perpetuated by Ruqqord and admins that they view the current base as a *problem.*

parent.body:
I don't think it's unreasonable to want to serve a wider audience - the majority of posts made on here cater to a very specific (and often toxic) group of people. Whether it's disinformation, far-right circlejerking, or straight-up racism, most people don't want to see it. I supported the admins' decision to hide political guilds from All by default - it should help cultivate a broader audience by bolstering non-political guilds. Without those, Ruqqus is basically just Voat but slightly less degenerate. 

What I *don't* support, however, is the formation of Ruqqus's AHS analogue (Ruqqus Corrective Project), the weaponization of the platform's Siege function, and the approval these actions seem to have from the admins. This runs counter to the platform's core value: free speech. 

I'm hoping that the admins will see this outcry from their community and find a way to make the site presentable to non-political users, while not stifling those who want to participate in the political side of things. It seems like once they modify the Siege function to only be usable in the case of inactive GMs, we'll see some progress.

post.body:
Long story short, admins and a majority of Ruqqus Discord strongly dislike the current â€œnaziâ€ - yeah, they use that term unironically - userbase. A good amount of Ruqqord users want to shit on and drive users they donâ€™t like off the site and admins seem to want to replace their base and cater to a more mainstream audience. These users for all intents and purposes hate Ruqqus and Ruqqus users, would be happier on Reddit, and are consistently (purposely) demoralizing when it doesnâ€™t make sense to be. Yet the admins seem more than willing to take cues from them.

So you have users that are generally popular or at least neutral with the Ruqqus base getting eyed, jumped on, and treated spitefully by the admins because the Ruqqord base hates and constantly complains about those users. Yet, youâ€™ve got those same Ruqqord users in the RCP server planning brigades, sieging and subverting guilds of users they get banned, playing Carps games and being obnoxious to everybody else and the Admins do nothing.

The admins always side with Ruqqord over the Ruqqus base. Because they donâ€™t like the Ruqqus base. And, Ruqqord is really just a few loud, whiny people typing the same thing over and over and then the rest just falling in line after they know what to think.

Basically, it seems like they want Redditâ€™s userbase and resent the niche that they already have and can build upon because it doesnâ€™t make Ruqqus look favorable to the mainstream. They donâ€™t want to promote Ruqqus and refuse to market it until theyâ€™ve released Vue and are better able to hide the â€œundesirables.â€

So, if it feels like thereâ€™s animosity towards a bunch of the users here and like theyâ€™re working against you, they kind of are.

That is my experience and take away from being in the Ruqqord

body:
Nobody likes the nazi users because they're fucking annoying. They have the right to be here, yes, but nobody sane wants to deal with them. If they want to be that offputting, then they can accept being outcasts with a right to speak.

Most of this admin drama is annoying and seems to come from people who don't have the site's interests at heart.

body:
That's not what I'm talking about:

* Admins let you get away with breaking (minor) rules like word filters and banned gifs

* Admins blatantly let you abuse being in channels you didn't earn access to

* Admins always favor you for guildmasters or or focus groups or whatever else

* Admins disable literally every restriction for you

* Admins give you more transparency and feedback on ruqqus than other users

* All the discord mods on github have write access to the codebase

* Admins let you pin your messages and get above everyone else (and for much more than mod stuff)

* Admins clearly show a favoritism for you and resolve to have only those users as mods, guildmasters, or anything else

* And yes, the admins were talking about a feature to let the "trusted users" administratively remove posts and admin distinguish, and a few other bits of admin-level authority.

Also *please* stop white knighting for the admins. You were super nice until 2 weeks ago, then you suddenly started barging in on peoples' conversations and shitting on them, especially when they say anything negative at all about the admins. Please don't follow cap's narcissistic attitude, it's not healthy.

body:
> I supported the admins' decision to hide political guilds from All by default

I didn't. Few people if any are here for anything other than politics. It is ridiculous, akin to shooting yourself in the foot, to hide politics by default. If not just show politics and be done with it, it would've been better to show the user a prompt asking whether or not he wants to see politics.

> Ruqqus's AHS analogue (Ruqqus Corrective Project),

You're mistaken. Ruqqus's AHS analogue is +AgainstChudGuilds. The Ruqqus Communist Party, while often mistaken for the former, is a separate entity with different goals, even though their means are **sometimes** alike.

> It seems like once they modify the Siege function to only be usable in the case of inactive GMs

Uh... what? That's already the case. Inactive guildmasters **or** permanently banned guildmasters.

parent.body:
I don't think it's unreasonable to want to serve a wider audience - the majority of posts made on here cater to a very specific (and often toxic) group of people. Whether it's disinformation, far-right circlejerking, or straight-up racism, most people don't want to see it. I supported the admins' decision to hide political guilds from All by default - it should help cultivate a broader audience by bolstering non-political guilds. Without those, Ruqqus is basically just Voat but slightly less degenerate. 

What I *don't* support, however, is the formation of Ruqqus's AHS analogue (Ruqqus Corrective Project), the weaponization of the platform's Siege function, and the approval these actions seem to have from the admins. This runs counter to the platform's core value: free speech. 

I'm hoping that the admins will see this outcry from their community and find a way to make the site presentable to non-political users, while not stifling those who want to participate in the political side of things. It seems like once they modify the Siege function to only be usable in the case of inactive GMs, we'll see some progress.

That's not what I'm talking about:

* Admins let you get away with breaking (minor) rules like word filters and banned gifs

* Admins blatantly let you abuse being in channels you didn't earn access to

* Admins always favor you for guildmasters or or focus groups or whatever else

* Admins disable literally every restriction for you

* Admins give you more transparency and feedback on ruqqus than other users

* All the discord mods on github have write access to the codebase

* Admins let you pin your messages and get above everyone else (and for much more than mod stuff)

Also *please* stop white knighting for the admins. You were super nice until 2 weeks ago, then you suddenly started barging in on peoples' conversations and shitting on them, especially when they say anything negative at all about the admins. Please don't follow cap's narcissistic attitude, it's not healthy.

parent.body: Is this just entirely discord drama? Does none of this have to do with Ruqqus?
parent.body_html: Is this just entirely discord drama? Does none of this have to do with Ruqqus?

post.body:
Long story short, admins and a majority of Ruqqus Discord strongly dislike the current â€œnaziâ€ - yeah, they use that term unironically - userbase. A good amount of Ruqqord users want to shit on and drive users they donâ€™t like off the site and admins seem to want to replace their base and cater to a more mainstream audience. These users for all intents and purposes hate Ruqqus and Ruqqus users, would be happier on Reddit, and are consistently (purposely) demoralizing when it doesnâ€™t make sense to be. Yet the admins seem more than willing to take cues from them.

So you have users that are generally popular or at least neutral with the Ruqqus base getting eyed, jumped on, and treated spitefully by the admins because the Ruqqord base hates and constantly complains about those users. Yet, youâ€™ve got those same Ruqqord users in the RCP server planning brigades, sieging and subverting guilds of users they get banned, playing Carps games and being obnoxious to everybody else and the Admins do nothing.

The admins always side with Ruqqord over the Ruqqus base. Because they donâ€™t like the Ruqqus base. And, Ruqqord is really just a few loud, whiny people typing the same thing over and over and then the rest just falling in line after they know what to think.

Basically, it seems like they want Redditâ€™s userbase and resent the niche that they already have and can build upon because it doesnâ€™t make Ruqqus look favorable to the mainstream. They donâ€™t want to promote Ruqqus and refuse to market it until theyâ€™ve released Vue and are better able to hide the â€œundesirables.â€

So, if it feels like thereâ€™s animosity towards a bunch of the users here and like theyâ€™re working against you, they kind of are.

That is my experience and take away from being in the Ruqqord

body:
Honestly the 'userbase' is hurting Ruqqus' potential by just being reverse Reddit upvoting the 10,000th corrupt jew post to where it floods the main page with propaganda similar to Reddit's front page evil white male posts. It comes to a point you realize that some of these people aren't just shit posting and are one of the same mindset with the redditards and will blame those more fortunate than them as a scape goat for all problems and ban anyone who disagrees infecting their safe space with wrong think.

As it stands despite using Ruqqus everyday I don't even won't to recommend it to my friends and co-workers because of all the abundance of edge lord posts. If Ruqqus is truly to be better and learn from the failings of Reddit it should be apolitical, but that is hard to accomplish considering that the further right leaning the person the sooner they were forced off of left leaning platforms thus the more extreme right wing people make up the majority of popular posts currently. Hopefully more people will trickle and filling the site with more organic posts relating to other topics, but that may be a long while off if the climate continues as it is. That's why I'm actually really supportive of the moderators. When they were discussing what to do with the abundance of political posts on the site I suggested that further action should be reserved until after the election and I was surprise they responded and agreed with me. They actually discuss and have been very transparent with the community instead of with the Reddit changes where it's basically their way or the highway being on their knees for AHS. So I don't see why shitting on them for having a spine and not shilling out to the mob mentality scene I'm seeing more and more of on the site is a bad thing.

That said I'm a firm believer in free speech as well as freedom of accessibility so if more filtering changes are implemented I'd like it to be very upfront and not hidden beneath a multitude of options, similar to picking SFW or NSFW. Cultivating the site to be more apolitical I would see as desirable so it become actually a better Reddit instead of a different side of the same coin.

body:
Ruqqus cannot be apolitical. The majority of content will be political because Ruqqus is a reaction to the politics of Reddit. Ruqqus was born of political strife. Ruqqus was born because of leftist censorship. 

Ideally yes, we get more apolitical content, but it's never going to be an apolitical hub like Reddit once was because Reddit wasn't born out of politics. The solution is containment and innovation. Contain the politics so that communities that aren't political aren't dragged into it and make new social features for communities that Reddit and other social media sites can't offer.

parent.body:
Ruqqus cannot be apolitical. The majority of content will be political because Ruqqus is a reaction to the politics of Reddit. Ruqqus was born of political strife. Ruqqus was born because of leftist censorship. 

Ideally yes, we get more apolitical content, but it's never going to be an apolitical hub like Reddit once was because Reddit wasn't born out of politics. The solution is containment and innovation. Contain the politics so that communities that aren't political aren't dragged into it and make new social features for communities that Reddit and other social media sites can't offer.

That's not what I'm talking about:

* Admins let you get away with breaking (minor) rules like word filters and banned gifs

* Admins blatantly let you abuse being in channels you didn't earn access to

* Admins always favor you for guildmasters or or focus groups or whatever else

* Admins disable literally every restriction for you

* Admins give you more transparency and feedback on ruqqus than other users

* All the discord mods on github have write access to the codebase

* Admins let you pin your messages and get above everyone else (and for much more than mod stuff)

* Admins clearly show a favoritism for you and resolve to have only those users as mods, guildmasters, or anything else

* And yes, the admins were talking about a feature to let the "trusted users" administratively remove posts and admin distinguish, and a few other bits of admin-level authority.

Also *please* stop white knighting for the admins. You were super nice until 2 weeks ago, then you suddenly started barging in on peoples' conversations and shitting on them, especially when they say anything negative at all about the admins. Please don't follow cap's narcissistic attitude, it's not healthy.

Long story short, admins and a majority of Ruqqus Discord strongly dislike the current â€œnaziâ€ - yeah, they use that term unironically - userbase. A good amount of Ruqqord users want to shit on and drive users they donâ€™t like off the site and admins seem to want to replace their base and cater to a more mainstream audience. So you have users that are generally popular or at least neutral with the Ruqqus base getting eyed, jumped on, and treated spitefully by the admins because the Ruqqord base hates and constantly complains about those users. Yet, youâ€™ve got those same Ruqqord users in the RCP server planning brigades, sieging and subverting guilds of users they get banned, playing Carps games and being obnoxious to everybody else and the Admins do nothing.

The admins always side with Ruqqord over the Ruqqus base. Because they donâ€™t like the Ruqqus base. And, Ruqqord is really just a few loud, whiny people typing the same thing over and over and then the rest just falling in line after they know what to think.

Basically, it seems like they want Redditâ€™s userbase and resent the niche that they already have and can build upon because it doesnâ€™t make Ruqqus look favorable to the mainstream. So, if it feels like thereâ€™s animosity towards a bunch of the users here and like theyâ€™re working against you, they kind of are.

That is my experience and take away from being in the Ruqqord

parent.body:
I don't think it's unreasonable to want to serve a wider audience - the majority of posts made on here cater to a very specific (and often toxic) group of people. Whether it's disinformation, far-right circlejerking, or straight-up racism, most people don't want to see it. I supported the admins' decision to hide political guilds from All by default - it should help cultivate a broader audience by bolstering non-political guilds. Without those, Ruqqus is basically just Voat but slightly less degenerate. 

What I *don't* support, however, is the formation of Ruqqus's AHS analogue (Ruqqus Corrective Project), the weaponization of the platform's Siege function, and the approval these actions seem to have from the admins. This runs counter to the platform's core value: free speech. 

I'm hoping that the admins will see this outcry from their community and find a way to make the site presentable to non-political users, while not stifling those who want to participate in the political side of things. It seems like once they modify the Siege function to only be usable in the case of inactive GMs, we'll see some progress.
parent.body_html:

I supported the admins' decision to hide political guilds from All by default - it should help cultivate a broader audience by bolstering non-political guilds. Without those, Ruqqus is basically just Voat but slightly less degenerate.

What I don't support, however, is the formation of Ruqqus's AHS analogue (Ruqqus Corrective Project), the weaponization of the platform's Siege function, and the approval these actions seem to have from the admins. This runs counter to the platform's core value: free speech.

I'm hoping that the admins will see this outcry from their community and find a way to make the site presentable to non-political users, while not stifling those who want to participate in the political side of things. It seems like once they modify the Siege function to only be usable in the case of inactive GMs, we'll see some progress.

Nobody likes the nazi users because they're fucking annoying. They have the right to be here, yes, but nobody sane wants to deal with them. If they want to be that offputting, then they can accept being outcasts with a right to speak.

Most of this admin drama is annoying and seems to come from people who don't have the site's interests at heart.

post.body:
Long story short, admins and a majority of Ruqqus Discord strongly dislike the current â€œnaziâ€ - yeah, they use that term unironically - userbase. A good amount of Ruqqord users want to shit on and drive users they donâ€™t like off the site and admins seem to want to replace their base and cater to a more mainstream audience. These users for all intents and purposes hate Ruqqus and Ruqqus users, would be happier on Reddit, and are consistently (purposely) demoralizing when it doesnâ€™t make sense to be. Yet the admins seem more than willing to take cues from them.

So you have users that are generally popular or at least neutral with the Ruqqus base getting eyed, jumped on, and treated spitefully by the admins because the Ruqqord base hates and constantly complains about those users. Yet, youâ€™ve got those same Ruqqord users in the RCP server planning brigades, sieging and subverting guilds of users they get banned, playing Carps games and being obnoxious to everybody else and the Admins do nothing.

The admins always side with Ruqqord over the Ruqqus base. Because they donâ€™t like the Ruqqus base. And, Ruqqord is really just a few loud, whiny people typing the same thing over and over and then the rest just falling in line after they know what to think.

Basically, it seems like they want Redditâ€™s userbase and resent the niche that they already have and can build upon because it doesnâ€™t make Ruqqus look favorable to the mainstream. They donâ€™t want to promote Ruqqus and refuse to market it until theyâ€™ve released Vue and are better able to hide the â€œundesirables.â€

So, if it feels like thereâ€™s animosity towards a bunch of the users here and like theyâ€™re working against you, they kind of are.

That is my experience and take away from being in the Ruqqord
